item.title: Pellerin rd estate parking signs blacked out. No parking for residents as itâ€™s a free for all, 20th September
item.description:
Residents paid parking has become impossible to use due to blacked out parking permit signs so all can park regardless . Been happening for over a year upto 3/4 weeks at a time. Non residents using this car park for FREE !
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trumans road major illegal parking & congestion, 20th September
item.description:
Constant illegal parking on double yellow lines, on bends , parking in front of road gates & residents parking . Cars/vans trucks daily cause major congestion & restrict freedom of movement. Fri/sat/sun evenings weekdays all day
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trumans Road is Filthy , restaurants bins filled & pilled on top, on pavements, 20th September
item.description:
Disgusting, Rubbish bags on the pavement, stacked on top of bins, fluids all over the pavements, dumped rubbish from earth venue & fuelled by local restaurants dumping black bags throughout the day & night . Stench, rats a daily occurrence in Trumans Rd
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless living in tent, damaging pond bushes and littering, 20th September
item.description:
Man has been here for months now. has even upgraded to a massive tent, using the trees and bushes for all his things damaging them. Going to the bathroom in both ways in the pond area infront of any1 including young people - drinks all day littering

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree on public path blocking the whole path, 20th September
item.description:
Theres a fallen tree on the path blocking the way. When it rains the grass gets muddy and unsafe to walk on it to go around. Also overgrown hedges further down and thorns. This has been fof a few weeks now Got stung twice by wasps (very angry ones) so assume there was a nest nearby too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Carterhatch Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged to road, 19th September
item.description:
Itâ€™s a danger to cars, cyclists, or pedestrians. The pothole has broken through the tarmac and exposed the base, creating a serious hazard. This road and pavement are in urgent need of repair, not just temporary patching. The surface condition has become unsafe and requires proper resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dale Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
